trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Cromwell
There were no other sightings in Cromwell on or around April 2nd 2010
divs: sighting detailswent out side briefly at 9pm sharp est to check sky conditions as i am amateur astronomer in central ct. noticed a very dim extreme high altitude object moving true north from dead overhead. faint orange\yellow as bright as a secondary star. hard to tell exact color. not a commercial aircraft, was way too high from my perspective maybe u2. did not blink or flash. lost sight as it moved towards the hartford haze. took approximately 1 minute to travel from dead overhead until i lost sight in north. this is the second time in 6 months that i noticed this object in same position same direction. got a better look at it this time. checked iss position and all other common satelite positions. could not verify object through any means. most satelites and iss that track across the sky generally move east to west fashion. would really like to know what it is. felt curious.
Summary: True northbound extreme high altitude object.
